address: Xã  Hòa Thuận, Huyện Giồng Riềng, Tỉnh Kiên Giang
thought:
**My Analysis of the Administrative Reorganization in Kiên Giang (Now An Giang)**

Okay, here's what I've got. The user wants to know the current administrative location for "Xã Hòa Thuận, Huyện Giồng Riềng, Tỉnh Kiên Giang." First, I needed to figure out the province. Kiên Giang merged with An Giang, so now it's all part of An Giang. Got it.

Next, I dove into the resolutions. Specifically, I'm checking "1654/NQ-UBTVQH15" to see if I can find my old "Xã Hòa Thuận". Lots of reorganizations are described here.

I went through the resolution, line by line, looking for any mention of "Xã Hòa Thuận". Finally, I hit line 66: "Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của xã Ngọc Hòa và xã Hòa Thuận thành xã mới có tên gọi là **xã Hòa Thuận**." Bingo! This clearly states that "Xã Hòa Thuận" is now combined with "Xã Ngọc Hòa", and the *new* commune will also be named "Xã Hòa Thuận." This seems to be the crucial piece of information.

The resolution doesn't explicitly mention the district (Giồng Riềng) in this line, which is somewhat odd, but given the context of the old address and the other entries in the same resolution explicitly mentioning districts, I'm noting this as a possible match. It's a bit ambiguous, but this new resolution says that the *new* commune is named the same, which is a major data point.

citation.header: 60-NQ/TW: Các đơn vị hành chính cấp tỉnh mới sau sáp nhập, hợp nhất
citation.line: Hợp nhất tỉnh An Giang và tỉnh Kiên Giang, lấy tên là tỉnh An Giang
